ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] FW: Lullaby tale
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, at 34 I have outrun Grim and Shadowmen... it s tough to get out of melee range (Grimmy has long arms) but once you are you ll outdistance him with MM
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, at 34 I have outrun Grim and Shadowmen... it's tough to get out of
melee range (Grimmy has long arms) but once you are you'll outdistance him
with MM at 34th. I can get ahead. And stay ahead. If I need to get away
REALLY fast I just throw in strafing ;) It tacks on a little more speed
pluss Grimmy has to fly at angles periodically. As do Shadows

Lyrnia

> Hmm, at 34 I would *not* wanna race either Grimfeather nor Shadowmen -
even
> with Mistmoore drum. At 37, with MM drum, I am pretty sure I was beatin
> Grim - never actually ran from Shadowmen.
>
> Sylly
>
> p.s. at 35, down to less than a bub of hp and with Grim on my butt and
> closing, one last desperate measure, siren song! It stuck, /pet guard
here,
> selos'd across the wood bridge to safety. whew, i did not want to die.
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Kevin L. Crawford <Lyrnia@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Friday, April 07, 2000 10:11 AM
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] FW: Lullaby tale
>
>
> > Yup, with a drum a bard can outrun just about anything in the game
> starting
> > at around oh... level 5 ;) As long as they aren't in the "slowdown"
area.
> >
> > At level 34 I can outrun anything even with about 50hp if I have a drum
> > equipped.
>
>
>
